thread.title: New Oxford celebrates autumn with Harvest Day
thread.title_full: New Oxford celebrates autumn with Harvest Day | Examiner.com

author: Laura Hermoza
title: New Oxford celebrates autumn with Harvest Day
text:
Come out to the annual New Oxford Harvest Festival tomorrow. (Photo Courtesy of New Oxford Area Chamber of Commerce) It’s once more time for Harvest Day, an annual event that takes place each season in New Oxford . This year’s Harvest Day will occur on Saturday, Oct. 24, in downtown New Oxford. Activities , vendors , and other setups will be concentrated and focused around 27 Center Square.
Come out for a day of activities, crafts vendors, and so much more, starting at 10 a.m. and running through 4:30 p.m. All ongoing events and activities are free and open to the public to take part in, including a great wealth of activities for kids. Some of the activities enjoyed most by young ‘uns include face painting, pumpkin painting, a bounce house, and other fun pastimes. Of course, there is also plenty to see and do for attendees of all other ages too.
Crafters will present a great variety items and homemade goods and products. There will also be loads of food vendors onsite to meet your every epicurean need and desire during the day.
One of the highlights of Harvest Day is the big parade through town. The parade will take to the streets starting at 3 p.m. at New Oxford High School and will make its rounds through the downtown scene bringing along floats, marching bands, antique vehicles, and—in making an early appearance—Santa Claus himself is coming along for the event!
New Oxford Harvest Day officially wraps things up at the Square at 4:30 p.m., but the fun continues even after the day is over with a fantastic block party, complete with live music.
There are several sponsors who make the annual New Oxford Harvest Day possible, including the New Oxford Social & Athletic Club , Adams Electric Cooperative , Member’s 1st Federal Credit Union , Utz Quality Foods , PWI , Douglas M. Miller Construction , Aero Energy , and Yazoo Mills .
You can learn more about Harvest Day in New Oxford by clicking here . Check out all the latest news and updates for this event here .
